Name: Airport Fire
Notes: Unknown cause

Name: Coastal Fire
Notes: Unknown cause; burned into a neighborhood and destroyed 20 homes

Name: Lost Lake Fire
Notes: Unknown cause

Name: Thunder Fire
Notes: Likely caused by lightning strike

Name: Roblar Fire
Notes: Unknown cause; 1 fatality from person trapped in a vehicle

Name: Electra Fire
Notes: Unknown cause, possibly fireworks from Fourth of July celebrations[39]

Name: Washburn Fire
Notes: Human caused, forced evacuations in Wawona and trail closures in Yosemite National Park; threatened Mariposa Grove

Name: Oak Fire
Notes: Unknown cause, forced evacuations in Mariposa County. Destroyed 182 structures and damaged 10 structures

Name: McKinney Fire
Notes: Possibly caused by power lines; destroyed 185 structures and caused 4 fatalities

Name: Yeti Fire
Notes: Probable lightning caused, forced evacuations in Siskiyou County, originally named the China 2 fire

Name: Summit Fire
Notes: Caused by lightning, was suppressed using indirect methods, burning in southern Sequoia National Park

Name: Red Fire
Notes: Lightning caused, burned in Yosemite National Park, not fully suppressed due to natural barriers

Name: Six Rivers Lightning Complex
Notes: Caused mandatory evacuations in Trinity and Humboldt counties, composed of multiple lightning fires that eventually merged into the Campbell Fire and Ammon Fire

Name: Rodgers Fire
Notes: Lightning caused, burned in Yosemite National Park, not fully suppressed due to natural barriers

Name: Route Fire
Notes: Burned near Interstate 5 and Castaic Lake, 1 structure destroyed and 7 firefighters injured

Name: Border 32 Fire
Notes: Burned near U.S./Mexico border, 10 structures destroyed

Name: Mill Fire
Notes: Burned in/near communities of Weed and Lake Shastina, destroyed 118 structures, caused 2 fatalities

Name: Mountain Fire
Notes: Burned 7 miles SW of Gazelle, 4 structures destroyed

Name: Radford Fire
Notes: Burned near Big Bear Lake, has caused evacuations in the region

Name: Fairview Fire
Notes: Burned near Hemet, caused 2 fatalities and destroyed 36 structures

Name: Mosquito Fire
Notes: Burned near Foresthill and caused evacuations in Placer and El Dorado County; destroyed 78 structures

Name: Barnes Fire
Notes: Caused by lightning, burned near Fort Bidwell in the Warner Mountains

Name: Fork Fire
Notes: Caused by a vehicle, destroyed 43 structures near North Fork
